title: Unable to send emails in Tbird from MS aliases
content:
Hi,

I have an Outlook email account with multiple aliases. If I send an email from the default outlook account, all is well. However, if I try and send an email from one of the aliases I get the following error.

"Sending of the message failed. Unable to authenticate to Outgoing server (SMTP) smtp.office365.com. Please check the password and verify the 'Authentication method' in 'Account Settings | Outgoing server (SMTP)'."

Setting on the alias accocunts are the same as the default.

Sending an email from the alias accounts in Win 10 mail works.

Please advise.

Regards,

Steve
creator: OzSteveC

title: Valid Certificate
content: Just had the most recent upgrade to Thunderbird. I now get a microsoft message when trying to download new messages, saying it cannot access an invalid certificate. Prior to this upgrade, I had to manually validate the certificate for my email provider every time I re-opened THunderbird, or tried to send outgoing emails. Although inconvenient, this system worked and I could use the email provider system. Thunderbird will not download any emails now or give me the usual error message that I can manually override to get emails to work. The mail server is: mail.besttelecom.net.au

NEED SOMEONE ABSOLUTELY BRILLIANT TO SOLVE THIS ONE !
creator: usa.michaelw

title: Can't receive email with btconnect
content:
Hi Guys, I wonder if you can help . I have had Monzilla Thunderbird App for some while , primarily used for email, and access to my email account with Microsoft and has always been a bit of a pain to say the least. That I fear is because it was never set up properly by myself in the first place.

However, at the moment I can't receive any email from my PC ......."bards@btconnect.com " unless I sign in via a webpage. However, access via my smartphone using supplied Outlook email app, no problem.

So I am hopeful that you guys can help me sort out my PC access once and for all.

The current problem has arisen after receiving a forced donation / subscription page from Mozilla having made my donation I still do not have access to my email and folders.

Brief history: i. Originally PC access to account via Monzilla working fine, (donations made at intervals to Monzilla). ii. Microsoft then changed security systems and servers and with current setup at the time I couldn't get access to email incoming or outgoing ( problem with Imap / PoP3 servers). iii. Fix provided by Monzilla with new account denoted as .... bards@btconnect.com (OWL) whatever OWL stands for I do not know, (annual subscription required). iv. Even with the use of this get around , I still had problems sending mail this I believe was a problem down to default passwords and old server settings. (confliction between default settings and original account settings and use of OWL ? ). v. As mentioned above the current problem has arisen after receiving a forced donation / subscription page from Mozilla having made my donation I still do not have access to my email. problem with server settings again. Don't know what's going on ? and I am thoroughly confused and would appreciate some help getting things back on track. Just in case I have some difficulty accessing this platform and this forum / help page it would be much appreciated if any help could also be sent to the following email addresses bards@btonnect.com and grahambardo@hotmail.co.uk Many thanks
creator: bards67

title: "Mail To" does not work
content:
Not sure if this is Thunderbird or Windows 11. I use to be able to go to a web page in a browser and share it via "Send to Mail" Extension. It would open my default email program and a new email with the URL of the page I'm on already in the message area of the new email. It is not working now, likely since I upgraded to Win 11.I've been to the Default Apps settings and set all mail extensions to Thunderbird and the problem remains. It doesn't matter what browser I use, I've tried 3 different ones. My default browser is Firefox and it is up to date. I've tried other Mail To extensions in all the browsers and none work. When I try to do this, I see a message that says opening Default Mail Handler, then nothing happens, nothing opens. All I can do is copy the URL of the page I want to send and paste it into a new email I've opened by manually opening Thunderbird.

Suggestion are appreciated.
creator: kbrick66

title: Messaggi scomparsi (missing mail)
content: Salve, 48 ore fa ho selezionato una trentina di messaggi da 'posta in arrivo' e li ho trasferiti in una cartella creata ex-novo, che ho nominato e posizionato nella sottorcartella 'archivi'. Faccio presente che in questa cartella sono già presenti numerose sottocartelle create in passato e che mai hanno creato problemi. Stamani, all'apertura di Thunderbird, non ho più trovato la cartella in questione. Ho cercato ovunque, anche i singoli messaggi con la stringa di ricerca. Ho anche controllato la posta online del mio provider (virgilio mail). Nessuna traccia delle mail archiviate. Ho commesso un errore? C'è modo di rimediare e recuperare i messaggi scomparsi? Mi scuso per il disturbo e rimango in attesa. Grazie. Michele, Firenze.

creator: ferdocs961

title: Create calendar event from email?
content:
I saw a post about creating a calendar event directly from email ([https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/que.../1091761]) and it mentioned using

Right Click-Convert To-Event or Task

However, I do not see that option. The post is archived so I cannot followup with the original posting.
creator: hahevam539

title: next & previous email
content: Ijust found the answer to my query. When viewing an email to see previous email press letter B, to see next press F
creator: IanDoughy

title: VCF is set as standard
content: It seems that Thunderbird has set a checkmark for the new feature Attach VCF to the messages I send. But I think that programs should never change my settings without explicitly telling me. It is now unticked.
creator: BjornEnemark

title: Installing Thunderbird
content: I'm trying to install Thunderbird on my new PC as I can no longer use Outlook (thanks Microsoft). I use Spectrum for my email (rbaldwin2@woh.rr.com), and I'm not able to get Thunderbird to work. I think I'm not getting the settings correct, so need help. I can be reached at my email address, or preferably from a live person at 937-416-9479. Thank you - Bob Baldwin
creator: rbaldwin2

title: how can I get this account on my cell phone?
content: how can I get this email account on my cell phone

title: 128.1.0 Nebula crash overnight every night.
content: 128.1.0 Nebula crash overnight every night.

title: Cannot receive or send email
content: My COX email was transferred to Yahoo a few months ago. I followed the procedure outlined by COX and changed over to Thunderbird as I had used before. Everything worked great until the morning of August 18. I cannot receive or send email. I have tried contacting Yahoo who will not help me unless I subscribe to their Premium Technology package. I would really like to talk with someone from Thunderbird but have not found any help. HELP I cannot receive or send email
creator: sharyn.felton

title: Problem
content: hey, After the last 2 updates, my quick filtering (ctrl+shift+K) broke. It works very slowly, it freezes the entire program. Is there any way to fix this? I work on Windows 10, regularly updated
creator: klebowski

title: How do I create a new mailing list in thunderbird?
content:
How to created new mailing list. The online instructions, last updated 2015, say : "Create a mailing list 

   Open the Address Book.    Select File > New > Mailing List.    Enter a suitable name for the mailing list.

but "mailing list" does not appear when i select file> new
creator: dianebc22

title: Bad version.  Possible to rollback?
content: Is there anyway to rollback to the last version? 128 has all my mail accounts sorting, freezing or not downloading at all!
creator: whatmail454
